name: Creamed Pearl Onions
description: Tender glazed pearl onions in a rich cream sauce with Gruyère cheese, perfect for holiday meals.
ingredients: ¼ cup white wine or dry vermouth
¼ cup grated Gruyère or Parmesan
Optional: crispy pancetta, fresh thyme leaves, butter
Heat butter + olive oil in a wide skillet.
Add onions + sugar → sauté 5–7 minutes until lightly golden.
Add white wine → reduce by half.
Add chicken stock + thyme → simmer 10–12 minutes until mostly evaporated and onions are glazed.
Remove thyme and refrigerate in a sealed container.
Add cream, salt, pepper, and optional sherry/cognac to a small saucepan.
Bring to a bare simmer and cook 5–7 minutes until slightly thickened.
Refrigerate in a small sealed container.
Add glazed onions to a skillet.
Heat over medium-low until gently simmering.
Simmer 3–5 minutes until the sauce is glossy and coats the onions.
Simmer 1 minute until melted and silky.
Optional: add a knob of butter for extra sheen.
Stovetop: serve immediately for best texture
Hold: keep on low for up to 30 minutes
The separate storage keeps the onions firm and prevents the cream from getting gluey.
You can easily double this for a larger crowd — just expand the skillet size.
Pancetta or fresh thyme sprinkled on top makes it restaurant-level.
